intro: Ocotea zoque, commonly known as the Zoque ocotea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in southern Mexico and northern Central America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and aromatic leaves, which emit a pleasant scent when crushed. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils within tropical rainforests. Ocotea zoque is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
